Banach-Alaoglu

Let KKK be a non-empty compact subset of R3\R^3R3. For any Borel probability measure μ\muμ on KKK, define the Newtonian energy I(μ)∈(0,∞]I\p{\mu} \in \poc{0, \infty}I(μ)∈(0,∞] by

I(μ)=∫K∫K1∣x−y∣ dμ(x) dμ(y)I\p{\mu} = \int_K \int_K \frac{1}{\abs{x - y}} \,\diff\mu\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{y}I(μ)=∫K​∫K​∣x−y∣1​dμ(x)dμ(y)

and let RKR_KRK​ be the infimum of I(μ)I\p{\mu}I(μ) over all Borel probability measures μ\muμ on KKK. Show that there exists a Borel probability measure μ\muμ such that I(μ)=RKI\p{\mu} = R_KI(μ)=RK​.
Solution.

By definition, there exists a sequence of Borel probability measures {μn}n\set{\mu_n}_n{μn​}n​ on KKK such that I(μn)→RKI\p{\mu_n} \to R_KI(μn​)→RK​. Viewing {μn}n⊆(C(K))∗\set{\mu_n}_n \subseteq \p{C\p{K}}^*{μn​}n​⊆(C(K))∗, we find via Banach-Alaoglu a Borel probability measure μ\muμ and a subsequence {μnk}k\set{\mu_{n_k}}_k{μnk​​}k​ such that for any continuous function f∈C(K)f \in C\p{K}f∈C(K),

∫Kf(x) dμn(x)→n→∞∫Kf(x) dμ(x).\int_K f\p{x} \,\diff\mu_n\p{x} \xrightarrow{n\to\infty} \int_K f\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{x}.∫K​f(x)dμn​(x)n→∞​∫K​f(x)dμ(x).

Next, we will show that μn⊗μn→μ⊗μ\mu_n \otimes \mu_n \to \mu \otimes \muμn​⊗μn​→μ⊗μ weakly on C(K×K)C\p{K \times K}C(K×K). Notice that A={∑k=1nfk(x)gk(y)∣fk,gk∈C(K)}A = \set{\sum_{k=1}^n f_k\p{x}g_k\p{y} \mid f_k, g_k \in C\p{K}}A={∑k=1n​fk​(x)gk​(y)∣fk​,gk​∈C(K)} is closed under addition, scalar multiplication, and multiplication. It also separates points: if (x,y)≠(x′,y′)\p{x, y} \neq \p{x', y'}(x,y)=(x′,y′), say, x≠x′x \neq x'x=x′, then x⋅1x \cdot 1x⋅1 separates them. Since 1∈A1 \in A1∈A, it vanishes nowhere, so by Stone-Weierstrass, AAA is dense in C(K×K)C\p{K \times K}C(K×K). Hence, given ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0 and f∈C(K×K)f \in C\p{K \times K}f∈C(K×K), there exist g,h∈C(K)g, h \in C\p{K}g,h∈C(K) such that ∥f(x,y)−g(x)h(y)∥L∞<ε\norm{f\p{x, y} - g\p{x}h\p{y}}_{L^\infty} < \epsilon∥f(x,y)−g(x)h(y)∥L∞​<ε. By weak convergence, if nnn is large enough, then

∣∫K×Kg(x)h(y) dμ(x) dμ(x)−∫K×Kg(x)h(y) dμn(x) dμn(x)∣=∣(∫Kg dμ)(∫Kh dμ)−(∫Kg dμn)(∫Kh dμn)∣≤∣(∫Kg dμ)(∫Kh dμ)−(∫Kg dμ)(∫Kh dμn)∣+∣(∫Kg dμ)(∫Kh dμn)−(∫Kg dμn)(∫Kh dμn)∣≤∣∫Kg dμ∣∣∫Kh dμ−∫Kh dμn∣+∣∫Kh dμn∣∣∫Kg dμ−∫Kg dμn∣≤ε,\begin{aligned} \abs{\int_{K \times K} g\p{x}h\p{y} \,\diff\mu\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{x} - \int_{K \times K} g\p{x}h\p{y} \,\diff\mu_n\p{x} \,\diff\mu_n\p{x}} &= \abs{\p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu} - \p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu_n} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n}} \\ &\leq \abs{\p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu} - \p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n}} + \abs{\p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n} - \p{\int_K g \,\diff\mu_n} \p{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n}} \\ &\leq \abs{\int_K g \,\diff\mu}\abs{\int_K h \,\diff\mu - \int_K h \,\diff\mu_n} + \abs{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n}\abs{\int_K g \,\diff\mu - \int_K g \,\diff\mu_n} \\ &\leq \epsilon, \end{aligned}∣∣​∫K×K​g(x)h(y)dμ(x)dμ(x)−∫K×K​g(x)h(y)dμn​(x)dμn​(x)∣∣​​=∣∣​(∫K​gdμ)(∫K​hdμ)−(∫K​gdμn​)(∫K​hdμn​)∣∣​≤∣∣​(∫K​gdμ)(∫K​hdμ)−(∫K​gdμ)(∫K​hdμn​)∣∣​+∣∣​(∫K​gdμ)(∫K​hdμn​)−(∫K​gdμn​)(∫K​hdμn​)∣∣​≤∣∣​∫K​gdμ∣∣​∣∣​∫K​hdμ−∫K​hdμn​∣∣​+∣∣​∫K​hdμn​∣∣​∣∣​∫K​gdμ−∫K​gdμn​∣∣​≤ε,​

since {∫Kg dμn}n,{∫Kh dμn}n\set{\int_K g \,\diff\mu_n}_n, \set{\int_K h \,\diff\mu_n}_n{∫K​gdμn​}n​,{∫K​hdμn​}n​ are convergent, hence bounded sequences. Thus,

∣∫K×Kf d(μ⊗μ)−∫K×Kf d(μn⊗μn)∣≤∫K×K∣f−gh∣ d(μ⊗μ)+∫K×K∣f−gh∣+ d(μn⊗μn)+∣∫K×Kgh d(μ⊗μ)−∫K×Kgh d(μn⊗μn)∣≤εμ(K)2+εμn(K)2+∣∫K×Kgh d(μ⊗μ)−∫K×Kgh d(μn⊗μn)∣≤3ε\begin{aligned} \abs{\int_{K \times K} f \,\diff\p{\mu \otimes \mu} - \int_{K \times K} f \,\diff\p{\mu_n \otimes \mu_n}} &\leq \int_{K \times K} \abs{f - gh} \,\diff\p{\mu \otimes \mu} + \int_{K \times K} \abs{f - gh} + \,\diff\p{\mu_n \otimes \mu_n} + \abs{\int_{K \times K} gh \,\diff\p{\mu \otimes \mu} - \int_{K \times K} gh \,\diff\p{\mu_n \otimes \mu_n}} \\ &\leq \epsilon\mu\p{K}^2 + \epsilon\mu_n\p{K}^2 + \abs{\int_{K \times K} gh \,\diff\p{\mu \otimes \mu} - \int_{K \times K} gh \,\diff\p{\mu_n \otimes \mu_n}} \\ &\leq 3\epsilon \end{aligned}∣∣​∫K×K​fd(μ⊗μ)−∫K×K​fd(μn​⊗μn​)∣∣​​≤∫K×K​∣f−gh∣d(μ⊗μ)+∫K×K​∣f−gh∣+d(μn​⊗μn​)+∣∣​∫K×K​ghd(μ⊗μ)−∫K×K​ghd(μn​⊗μn​)∣∣​≤εμ(K)2+εμn​(K)2+∣∣​∫K×K​ghd(μ⊗μ)−∫K×K​ghd(μn​⊗μn​)∣∣​≤3ε​

which proves the claim. To complete the proof, observe that (x,y)↦1∣x−y∣\p{x, y} \mapsto \frac{1}{\abs{x - y}}(x,y)↦∣x−y∣1​ is lower semicontinuous: it is continuous, except when x=yx = yx=y, where it is infinity. It is also bounded below by 000, so there exists a sequence of non-negative continuous functions {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ which increase to it. Thus,

∫K×KfN(x,y) dμ(x) dμ(y)=lim⁡n→∞∫K×KfN(x,y) dμn(x) dμn(y)≤lim⁡n→∞I(μn)=RK.\begin{aligned} \int_{K \times K} f_N\p{x, y} \,\diff\mu\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{y} &= \lim_{n\to\infty} \int_{K \times K} f_N\p{x, y} \,\diff\mu_n\p{x} \,\diff\mu_n\p{y} \\ &\leq \lim_{n\to\infty} I\p{\mu_n} \\ &= R_K. \end{aligned}∫K×K​fN​(x,y)dμ(x)dμ(y)​=n→∞lim​∫K×K​fN​(x,y)dμn​(x)dμn​(y)≤n→∞lim​I(μn​)=RK​.​

By monotone convergence,

I(μ)≤lim⁡N→∞∫K×KfN(x,y) dμ(x) dμ(y)≤RK.I\p{\mu} \leq \lim_{N\to\infty} \int_{K \times K} f_N\p{x, y} \,\diff\mu\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{y} \leq R_K.I(μ)≤N→∞lim​∫K×K​fN​(x,y)dμ(x)dμ(y)≤RK​.

By definition of RKR_KRK​, RK≤I(μ)R_K \leq I\p{\mu}RK​≤I(μ), so these are equalities.
